intro: Dockrillia convoluta, commonly known as the spiral dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its spirally arranged leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in terminal inflorescences. Dockrillia convoluta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
